as a vetran teacher i have a few suggestions talk to your daughter about internet safety and etiquette in general [be internet awesome ] have an honest conversation about predators the internet is like being at an amusement park you may alk to the person in li e next to you but you do not give them identifiable information [videos for kids and under about safety predators and what to] get the user name of the person talking to her on roblox contact roblox and request that this account and all future accounts created by this person be blocked from accessing your daughter also let them know you suspect it is a predator if parents and kids don't report the company doesn't know find out what she enjoys about roblox minecraft is similar but from what my students tell me safer start building an open relationship with your daughter she needs to know she can tell you about her life without judgment or punishment leave her in school you can not control her actions she is an individual with her own thoughts and feelings if you pull her out of school most likely she will resent you please excuse any spelling or grammar errors i am the sleep deprived parent of a newborn

i think pulling her out would be a little aggressive but ultimately you are the parent have you had the internet safety discussion in depth my parents always told me that everyone was a stranger and could be dangerous but never went deep into it i spent years of my life chatting online with strangers some probably were dangerous but i knew not to give personal information and it all stayed on the screen it’s unrealistic in this day and age to expect no contact from computers i mean i met my husband online even the epitome of stranger danger but if you teach her safety and monitor her usage you will have better success in the long run than shutting it out completely
yeah homeschooling her isn't the answer contact roblox let them know this person's username and that you want him blocked from contacting her
that's a huge overreaction instead of being so controlling educate her about the dangers of internet strangers and imo you should get some help for yourself too

common sense media has some lessons free you just have to create an account that could help guide the conversation i work with middle school aged students and this is a hard age with regard to virtual friendships they cannot tell what is safe or not and they feel absolutely that they can so confronting them ultimately backfires common sense media helps them to see the warning signs and facilitates a conversation that doesn’t make them defensive it’s such a difficult time to be a parent and a tween there is no rule as to when or how much social media is safe and then they compare to friends with more lax parents and they feel rebellious and hurt that they don’t have the same come at the conversation with immense compassion try to start with several ways you see their point and then see if you can bring up why you’re concerned and see if they’d like to dialogue with you solutions that feel safe if she has buy in and becomes comfortable knowing you will listen she’ll return to you honestly when a weird situation online comes up again good luck

eh alright i’ll bite the legal minimum age to sign up for accounts on most social media platforms even ones that are going to be “monitored” by parents or are “family” accounts is thirteen whilst there may not be any major crack downs happening to address the large amount of underaged and unmonitored users that doesn’t mean letting your kid have one is harmless or necessary plain old texting on whatever built in messaging app that comes with every phone is still something people do every day without requiring any fancy stickers or reactions from another app to keep it fun at the same time however there’s gonna be a day where your kid is going to need a phone and her impulse control issues will no longer be an excuse to not give her one though that doesn’t necessarily mean she can just put whatever she wants on it without you knowing being unable to see what she’s doing iphones can be set as a child account that you can have a access and control over from your phone that she will not be able to easily bypass without you knowing many other types of phones have apps or similar system programming that allow the same level of monitoring with very few workarounds even the most tech savvy kid would have trouble figuring out without leaving a trail behind for you to follow ultimately it’s your choice as to when if your daughter gets a phone of her own and what she can do on it but educating her on cyber safety and what’s expected of her before giving her a phone will be more beneficial in the long run rather than just holding out until it’s absolutely necessary or she’s old enough to pay for her own and having her be glued to it

to start i think you’re doing great i don’t know that anyone has a tried and true answer to any of this all we have are opinions that said as someone who lives in silicon valley i can assure you most parents who work in the tech industry limit their children’s exposures to social media in particular and in some cases do not even allow devices in their rooms family room computer type stuff i know this because i do not hesitate to ask every time i meet someone who works for these companies and i’m never shocked by their answer just angry because they are getting rich off something they know has an incredible downside to others children’s while protecting their own the best they can schools are beginning responsible tablet use in kindergarten now so that these kids can learn how to use them for educational purposes so between that and their limited use at home they’re getting plenty of exposure i know about five years ago there were signs in the middle schools here that said “wait until th” meaning wait until at least th grade to get them a phone or allow social media use i think maturity and responsible use has a lot to do with it and that comes with age perhaps someone else can update us on if that’s still the case regardless a lot of kids are being targeted on these platforms now by dealers trying to sell them prescriptions pills that are actually laced with fentanyl it literally just happened to audrina partridge’s year old niece this week and it’s led of an increase in shocking overdoses everywhere from young teens who are just curious and trying things that we might have found in our parents medicine cabinets once upon a time this is becoming a scary reality that a lot of people don’t talk about so regardless of what you decide please discuss this with your daughter so she knows how dangerous it is in the event any of her friends who do have social media are targeted

give them some supervised time on popular platforms teen culture is almost exclusively online these days preventing your child from accessing social media all together will isolate them from a majority of their peers let them “be in the know” so they can keep up with trends and events their friends are interested in you don’t want to make internet access or a phone feel scarce like a treat this can make your child over prioritize their time on social media encourage a healthy balance of digital and real life teach them to use social media to enhance real life maybe help your child create some of their own content
no right answer both yes and no can be correct in this case but if your child has adhd giving her free access to a phone is like giving an alcoholic a gift brandy you need to keep that in check

i was playing roblox at y old and im now i love that game with my whole heart yeah theres creeps but learning internet safety is sooooo valuable i had to learn it the hard way but now a days there are resources on how to manage roblox was there for me when i had no friends in real life cause i was kinda just to weird and had undiagnosed audhd and whatever other excuse or explanation roblox has a good system set up too for security just make sure to look at the settings and stuff maybe a gift card on holidays but roblox is easily a good introduction to internet culture without the scary bad influences especially the popular games on roblox

my son is and has a tablet buuuttt i have family link on my phone connected to his tablet he cannot download any games without my permission i can go on my phone to see what games he is playing i have complete control as to how many hours he can play and what apps i can ban he does have roblox but i turned off the chat on his tablet he can see others messages but he can't respond also with family link you can get it with a phone and you can turn it off or set time limits on any apps or on the tablet itself

i’m in the camp of delay especially social media internet communication apps as long as possible year olds don’t need smart phones i know what i did at on extremely limited dial up aol 🥴 that’s enough for me not to willingly participate in this pressured device ridiculousness for tweens i say from a place of not having to deal with it yet and also lots of fear a closely monitored with strict parental controls tablet with limited screen time keeps kids safe in parallel we should teach kids about why and how to navigate the internet safely within those boundaries and what red flags to be on the lookout for no matter how much you govern and lock down devices she’ll have a friend with a parent who won’t bother and you want her to be knowledgeable and confidently stand up for herself and learn from being impulsively sucked into something problematic online i agree with [wait til th] and even then i wouldn’t be opening the youtube flood gates

i don’t think she needs access to the worst parts of social media tiktok in particular at that age but not allowing *anything* is kind of far it would be better to let her have some connection with limits to start learning to regulate minutes of screen time for either roloblox or approved pre screened youtube or tv after homework and chores etc

my mom did this exact thing so i went behind her back online and got into bad situations i'd let her have supervised time on social media to prevent this also no youtube sounds strange otherwise understandable

my child is he only has a phone for safety purposes only we have it pretty locked down with parental controls he has no social media and we don't allow that at all he basically uses it to play minecraft when he doesn't have his tablet or to listen to music off

well she’s going to use these apps on her friend’s phones eventually behind your back so your strict rules won’t matter you can’t “preserve her youth” just because you don’t like what the other youth are doing there are genuine safety concerns over using all of those apps but it’s better to teach kids how to use them responsibly my son has adhd and he’s always had access to youtube and roblox just not tiktok yet cause he’s but for the other apps we talk about what’s appropriate and what isn’t and he’s not allowed to chat or comment on anything i also watch the videos he watches with him and play roblox with him too and we set time limits so when he’s played for a long period of time he has to put his device down and go play read or use his imagination for a bit he used to throw a fit about that but he’s much better now and doesn’t fight it so yes you’re doing her a disservice you should educate her on self control what is and isn’t okay to do on these apps and how long is a healthy amount of time to spend on them and have conversations about what she does on these apps to keep open communication if you don’t know how these apps work learn or ask her to teach you cause if you don’t take the lead here her friends will
has she had any therapy around her adhd because if it's impulse control that scares you maybe doing some work around that will help for when you do have to give her a phone one day😬

just as kind of a peripheral note that i think is worth considering apparently the vast majority of tech executives do not allow their teens on social media and or don't allow them to have phones you can google this there's been lots of reporting around it i just think that's really telling in terms of what they know that we don't about how ads and media are designed to keep us ever consuming anyway i think it's smart to keep things heavily locked down limited and monitored but i also think it makes sense to allow certain things in moderation only you can decide what's right for your family and your child my main suggestion is that if you start to loosen the reigns take baby steps and closely monitor your kid and any emotional behavioral changes and don't let your guard down as far as being attentive to how their media consumption social or otherwise is impacting their well being

honestly i have an year old daughter too and she doesn't use any of those things i've never even considered it in our case her friends don't really seem to use a bunch of screens either although maybe they do in their down time and they just don't talk about it but she doesn't facetime anyone and i've never heard kids talking about it i don't think my kids know was tiktok is and i have no idea what roblox is either i would stay the course there's little benefit and lots of documented harm from things like social media screen addiction these tools are meant for adults and even in adult hands they are addictive and are misused in all sorts of ways i really see no benefit for young people in terms of 'social pressure' well i guess when i reflect on that i think the following a the more people who resist the crowd impulse to 'give in' to everything that everyone else is doing the more company those people will have and the easier it becomes for others to follow suite b you are teaching daughter to be critical about things that are popular a valuable lesson in life c a thought what if the 'socially acceptable' or popular thing was something like pornography or drinking and driving for instance as parents our job is to evaluate what is hurtful or helpful to our kids to give them the tools they need through life and then hope they make the best decisions possible i personally view the harms associated with things like social media as being right up there with the examples i listed here so i don't really care if it's become something other people do i'm okay setting a standard for my kids that doesn't follow the norm and teaching them that we can question what is popular that's my two cents

id start to let her have supervised access with one at this point ie kids youtube she will start being able to make her own decisions too with your guidance even educational games be an option definitely a no no for social media

we’re pretty strict compared to my daughters friends parents and our siblings we filter what she watches on youtube and she only plays roblox next to us the one app i will probably not use for a long time for her is tiktok she’s almost she has fun with her friends and can relate to them but doesn’t have unlimited access on anything

so i had a lot of restrictions when i was a kid about what media i could and couldn’t consume i grew up just as mobile phones became more popular for older teens i got my first ever nokia when i went to uni in classmates had razr or flip phones and many others didn’t have a phone what i learned from growing up with restricted access to pop culture was that yes it did affect how well i fit into some settings to this day at age people make all sorts of references to things that i don’t get but at it doesn’t really matter i feel you’re doing better for your kid than not the impact of screen time and the fragmentation of attention and inability to be bored are genuinely quite harmful when she’s older i would get her a dumb phone for safety she can get a smart phone when she has a job or saves allowance if this is something you do or when it’s needed for a job your approach of having it on tablet and not phone is a good one as an adhd adult this is one way that i manage and limit my own over use of screens

roblox is dangerous imho my kids are only allowed to play with people we actually know and they have been warned not to talk to anybody they don't know not to use their real names never to give out their ages what town we live in etc my kids got phones relatively early and i regret it they're too dependent on them now and i hate it

my daughter is the same age no phone no tiktok no social media apps beyond messenger kids this doesn’t mean that we demonize screen time we don’t our kids have steam accounts and learn programming at a young age social media is the concern they can keep up with their friends on messenger kids and later via text when they are older we give gizmo watches in th grade and phones in th no snapchat etc ever you are not doing her a disservice goodness she sees these friends every day at school right i’m not sure when you were planning on introducing the phone but if it was th grade maybe at the end of this year if th grade maybe at the end of th just pointing out that i can see how it might be extra beneficial to have one in the summer

you’re absolutely not being too strict your kid is always going to tell you they think you are when you tell them no always you’re for sure on the correct side of this argument my yo got a phone this year for communication about the bus situation… an iphone was cheaper than one of those gadgets for kids that have limited capabilities for some annoying reason this kiddo is also adhd and can’t handle having a phone it’s been confiscated more than they’ve had it in their possession for now they’re on the same bus as their older sibling but that changes next year we have it very locked down and there is no social media usage but it’s still managed to cause drama amongst them and their friends we’ve had none of this drama with my oldest personally and some will disagree with me this is very child dependent my oldest was able to handle a phone younger than my middle middle child is and still can’t handle it it’s also ok to make it that way we’ve told all the kids they can have a phone when a it’s needed and b they can handle having one we’re consistent with expectations across the board even though that means they’ll all probably end up with them at different ages

in my opinion you’re doing exactly the right thing especially if she’s got adhd those platforms do more harm than good anyway and in most cases have a minimum age older than your daughter to use i don’t think tiktok does though and it’s the worst one there are kid safe options like gabb phone or bark phone gabb phone looks like a smartphone but has no internet access bark phone does everything a normal smartphone does but it is all parent controlled and parent monitored you can see everything they do on it from your account and they can’t delete texts without permission one of those is what we will be getting my kids when they get to maybe or before that they won’t have anything there’s no need for it if i had my way they wouldn’t get a phone until they are driving but my wife will probably push for a little earlier i’m ok with that as long as it’s one of those phones

i think you're doing great we are a little more permissive than you we allow supervised youtube but i generally think the same thing there are so many studies about teen depression low self esteem self harm associated with social media i'd rather have an awkward child than a suicidal one i think as long as your child has some exposure to the online world she'll do okay with her peers that's part of why we allow some youtube i don't want my son to have tiktok but he can watch a 'funny cats tiktok comp' and still have some ideas of what's going on there same with roblox no way i'd let him play roblox but he can watch a trusted gaming channel on youtube play through a roblox game so he can see what it's like

by i'd be getting them a phone even if it's a bare bones one without apps simply to stay in touch when out the more ive read about roblox though the more i think i'd be against it at any age same with tiktok i know a lot of adults who can't control themselves on it much less a child

i always compare an extreme comparison of course these things to the episode “angel” from black mirror but from personal experience i was sheltered in a similar manner by my grandparents who were scared of everything coming around i’m for reference so like internet and cell phones i couldn’t have myspace or a cell phone or aim i ended up making accounts on friends phones or computers at their houses and became very sneaky my first boyfriend was and i was and he was “happy to teach me everything i’ve been missing out” and absolutely picked me because i ended up being so naive and because i just really wanted to be liked and got bullied for my grandparents overprotectiveness i made bad choices based off of trying to still seem cool to everyone with my yr old she has an iphone and can text or call family and has educational games we don’t do roblox or tiktok or social media in general at of course but by i don’t think i’d be limiting those rather trying to educate her on safe vs unsafe we are very open and i’d rather take the time to educate her on the why the how the who and the what’s about the different dangers and keep an open line of communication and also my family had no idea i’ve told them now as an adult what i did and they were shocked and said “oh no way you were such a sweet innocent kid at we would have noticed ” while i was drinking already smoking cigarettes and having sex by so from that experience of myself i’m very cautious on creating an environment that my kids hide from me my step son is and goes on social medias and video games and has since and we are very open he talks to us when he likes a girl and asks for advice he tells us when people on the game are being too rude he tells us when he thinks he’s hanging with wrong people because they were stealing and he’d like to go home and i think our trust in him and us knowing that he will experience a lot whether we like it our not has helped

ultimately she will using the technology that you are preventing her from using **her entire life** and you should consider teaching her how to use it the worse thing that you can do to someone with adhd is shelter them i just want to put this into a different perspective for you what happens when she goes to college and you're not there to stop certain behavior or impose limitations adhd is not a disease dont treat it as such instead teach her life skills that help her navigate a society that was not made for her and it starts with responsible use of technology **poor impuse control doesnt mean she cant get better** but she needs the opportunity to practice so she can develop her skills

it depends on the child but screen time in our house has been permitted with parental supervision and restriction to age appropriate content as long as there's continued compliance to the house rules surrounding screen time barring any behavioral issues my personal rule for my son has been that as soon as he's autonomous enough to do things on his own i e walk to school by himself go to extracurriculars without my supervision hanging out with friends in the neighborhood without adults watching everybody's every move then a phone is necessary simply as a direct line of communication in case of emergency children with a parent nearby all the time do not need a phone because a parent is available to handle an emergency children without a parent or other trusted adults nearby will need something to act as a resource in case of emergency the age at which this autonomy can be achieved is so individual to every family child that it's just not useful to look at literal age suggestions for any of this i don't like the social media world we live in but that can be monitored the more i thought about removing what is really at its most basic a gps + device just because my kid might find some shitty app to use with his friends the more authoritarian i felt about it i believe it's my job to raise my son around more fulfilling people activities so that shitty apps games don't look so enticing to him when they will fly at him
children do not belong on social media you are doing the right thing there is no reason she needs a regular cellphone great job

my almost year old is not on social media she can play roblox but only on family desktop that is in the kitchen she does play video games we have had to crack down and make sure it’s only friends irl that she’s playing with no cell phone she has an apple watch with a phone number for calling she can text on there and her ipad but i control who whe contacts are some contacts that i am on the fence about like a boy she has a crush on she can use my phone to text so i can monitor most of her friends have cell phones and social media at i think you need to at least allow some access on your own device so she can start to navigate you don’t want her hiding things and accessing on the dl and you don’t want her going crazy once she gains access every kid is different so depends on the kid i have a year old too and she’s had social media since and a phone since she has always been responsible and not impulsive she’s done fine my almost year old is impulsive and makes poor choices so she’s waiting longer till we see some responsibility and better impulse control

check out mommasgonecity on instagram she has a highlight about kids and phones that scares the shit out of me my baby is only weeks but we’re waiting as long as possible also you can look at waittil th instagram you’re not being too strict you’re protecting your child from something their developing brain cannot manage

prepaid flip phone we got one for our kid and it's working just fine for us portable cd player and hand held games and a strict lock down on her ipad there are also nicer minimalist smart phones that only allow text call and email but they're a little pricey and only work with a couple of phone services but it's probably what i'm gonna get for our term when she turns or kids don't need smart phones or social media

my daughter is and in th grade she has screen time but doesn't have her own phone and we do not allow social media and games like minecraft can only play at home with their siblings not with the online connection i've explained to all of my children i have the reason for that i have a friend who before he retired was a cyber crime police and what he told me made me never want them to play games like that where you can't monitor who is online with them she has friends isn't ostracized and actually does things like read and play outside

my daughter just got her phone at she wasn’t responsible enough before now and sometime she still isn’t i would suggest getting a phone but limiting its use to evening hours after homework is done must be turned in to you at bedtime let her take it if she goes somewhere with friends in case of emergencies etc my daughter would be on social media and getting texts from friends all hours of the night also bullying would occur at all hours too it’s also leverage for chores and such my daughter gets in line real quick when i tell her she is in danger of loosing her phone privileges

don't give in if i could take it back i would you are doing wonderfully i would only caution that you have to prepare for the fact that she is probably getting negative visuals images messages from her friends at school through their phone make sure that she trusts you and wants to tell you what she is seeing in school or else she could start to become bitter and keep secrets
the internet is dangerous i don't blame you
ima say no especially to tiktok

check out the surgeon generals warning to parents that social media is a direct danger to children’s mental health have you not heard of all the children that have committed suicide as young as from online bullying consider how impressionable and underdeveloped a child’s brain is and what exposing them to these things does one example is completely trashing a young girls self esteem comparing themselves to ai fake women this can’t be a real post your job is to protect your child
i personally didnt get a phone until i was i had access to the computer for email and messenger and i'm fine so she will be too

no you’re doing everything right giving your child a phone because “all their friends have it” is a terrible idea and it’s the reason so many parents are awful at their jobs you’re not alienating her and you are protecting her

my daughter is now she can use snapchat on my phone but can only be friends with people *i* have personally met she has hockey friends on there she can use it on her phone for minutes a day she is not allowed to have tiktok or instagram youtube is fully blocked in our house she has pinterest but that’s it i know she comes across some stuff from tiktok but it’s better than having her nose in it constantly she also has adhd and only in the last few months have we given her more freedom with her phone but it still has tons of parental controls on it

i do think most kids are being damaged by how much phone screen time they're being exposed to from a young age but there also is some socially important weight for getting to participate in something all of your peers are doing too could you possibly get her a phone but start her out with some reasonable limits i'm imagining a phone available after school until pm then it's turned into the parents room for overnight type of rule and work from there perhaps with a caveat that if grades fall below a certain average or too many homework assignments are missing then the phone goes away until academics are right again i do think your heart is in the right place and phones are seriously impacting children's attention span capabilities in general but in this day and age not having a phone for much longer is going to lead to much higher levels of social exclusion from her peers it probably already is tbh from a useful outlook maybe this could not only be a very much appreciated and memorable christmas present this year but also a valuable learning experience for you as parents to teach her about self control and limiting herself to a certain amount of phone time while also still prioritizing school responsibilities first and also establishing your rules for internet and phone safety it might be better to start this lesson at this age while you have more control to monitor what she's up to and she while still puts more weight into what you say

i posted somewhere before wait as long as you can roblox is bad had multiple experiences with tween on this somehow being able to talk to strangers not cool just don’t do it she will be fine wait wait wait

we raised two daughters right as this whole thing took off i e late s early s what we learned even then was that kids who did not have a phone got shut out of social life especially on weekends; both of ours would go to school on monday to find that their friends all got together on saturday after someone texted a group or they were just all chatting all weekend it became really pernicious and we finally gave in when they were i think and the younger one got a phone earlier imo it's as important for kids today to have access to chat as it was for teens to have a home phone in the s without it they are going to be left out that said i *don't* think it's necessary at all for them to have social media access that's another issue entirely you can limit phone use by literally taking it away from them at night or using parental controls or setting time limits filters on your network but these days *not* having a way to participate in group chats especially is going to be a social challenge well before th grade in my experience because it was a decade ago too

no your being an amazing parent my parents did not let me have a phone tablet anything until half way in to my senior year my rule for my kids will be when you have a good enough job to pay for the phone and the monthly bill for a year upfront then you can have one

yea you could be doint a disservice if you’re not prepared to give her more access to these spaces as she gets older you’ve basically cut her off form being able to communicate with her peers about what could be common interests and you aren’t giving her the opportunity to make the kind of choices that you feel you’ve raised her to make she may already feel alienated from other kids already and she’s going to have to make extra effort to find her place among them socially since she’s not going to be able to connect with them on a basis of shared interests parental controls are a available if you feel that she’s too impressionable to navigate youtube for appropriate content and other social spaces i think monitoring her use of these things instead of completely restricting them until proven necessary would be best compromise in this situation let her have a phone as well access to roblox and youtube and see if her behavior stays the same or if it’s going to cause her adhd symptoms to flare up and go from there edit don’t let her have tiktok though that dopamine pile will have her face plastered to her screen i know from personal experience because tiktok is who told me i had adhd in the first place after only one week on it the algorithm knows it’s users

i think to an extent she probably does feel quite isolated regardless of our feelings about phones and the internet they have become an integral part of daily life for the younger generations there likely is a gap between her and her peers because of how online the culture of this youngest generation is and i’m willing to bet there’s probably a lot of things she’s not exactly “in” on with the rest of them because of that but your intentions are good and i still think that limiting access is healthier in general especially after you mentioning that she has adhd and impulse issues all that stuff really does exacerbate the issue to a hefty extent particularly social media i’ve found it’s done a lot to decrease the attention spans of people by a ridiculous amount maybe there’s a compromise here where she can have limited access to a device and the internet in moderate quantities that way she’s not as left out i also think that if you make internet and phone use a very rare thing for her what will eventually happen is when she finally does get a phone because in this day and age she’ll probably eventually get one in her teens she’ll go crazy overboard with it in response i see the same thing in kids whose parents completely banned all tv or in kids whose parents forbid all soda and candy the minute their kids got access to those things they went crazy with overconsumption because they were never normalized to consume these particular things in moderation in a healthy manner you don’t want a phone the internet to become that sort of thing for her

keep her off socials and away from internet access as long as possible i don’t have time to link articles now but there is a great deal of scientifically studied relevant information to support that adolescents can be harmed greatly by having that kind of access there is no upside other than convenience keep her entertained in other ways letting her learn online navigation under your direct supervision is wise and prudent at her age keep it up

my daughter is the same age and we let her have hours of ipad time to play roblox or watch a movie or use fb messenger kids etc each friday and saturday night that’s the only time she uses her ipad you could “ease” her into it other than that i’d say you’re doing the right thing many children at our school are the same don’t have phones etc and i want to keep it that way for as long as possible

i feel you should meet in the middle why not a talk about internet creeps safe online play and behaviour and then roblox in the living room where you can kinda overhear if she messes up with frequent refresh talks about the creeps and expected behaviour it’s what i did for ages i limit roblox time to like an hour occasionally and prefer when she meets up with real life friends in there to play as for phone i’m a meanie and don’t give till th grade and it’s still just wifi for a few years but the kids have tablets and the yo uses facebook kids messenger just like yours is we’re an adhd house too so we have to limit electronics as they just literally can’t self limit so like even the teens phone has x amount of tiktok youtube time daily but unlimited communication etc and she even agrees it’s needed we tried unlimited over summer and it just doesn’t work yet

i've seen students who's parents don't let them have cell phones have trouble socializing everyone else is on a group chat and making plans and that one kid is completely left out that being said you're the parents no one else knows your kid as well or can tell you what to do

you could always give her a phone with a parent lock on some so she won't download certain apps but i feel like every kid needs a phone mostly to be safe if an accident kidnapping happens how is she gonna call for help
i think you should let her a phone and a few apps like youtube etc this isn’t the s anymore and you very much are giving her a disadvantage strict parents make sneaky kids
you’re doing her a favor the internet isn’t the tv of yester year people don’t seem to understand how much social media has and is contributing to teens feeling bad about themselves

my two cents we’ve had a great experience with our eldest and technology so far we’re developing a good relationship where we set boundaries and limits he has a phone but it’s gabb phone no internet no sm he has roblox as of this month but we have all parental controls set and monitor his gaming he has messenger kids on my phone so he can use it on occasion another thought i’ve had is that boys are getting ahead of the curve w technology and i don’t think that’s fair in my area girls seem more restricted to tech than boys i feel that there’s such a gendered difference i’d be incorporating tech more w your daughter but like in a positive and boundaried way
long long before devices existed my parents were too strict on me kids are always going to say that about their parents

my son got his phone when he was in th grade and that was only because he would be home alone for about minutes until my wife got home from work we do not let him have social media he is now and still no social media when we tried letting him have it he did some stupid stuff that could have gotten him in a lot of trouble he also used social media messaging to get drugs and alcohol they apparently use snapchat to order whatever they want so this has lead to my son having a drug and alcohol addiction he’s already been in outpatient drug and alcohol counseling and therapy my suggestion if you don’t think they are ready for it then don’t do it or you can get a phone and put a lot of restrictions on it just be careful
my stepson is almost and we just got him a phone & disabled most features on it we only got it because he walks to school and back imo you’re certainly doing the right thing

my daughter is the same age she has a dummy phone so she can text talk and take pictures we restrict her screen time she’s fine and has a ton of friends she’s a lot more relaxed and sure of herself than the students who have all the technology i can say that with authority because i teach in her school trust me there are other kids in the same boat she’s not one of the only ones without
yes and it’s dangerous you’re not teaching any regulation safety or literacy and she’s more likely to get into bad situations because of it

raise her with tools and awareness not fear and eschewing the unknown what is it exactly that you’re afraid of with parental controls and monitoring work together to learn about all the good and bad that can happen online tween and teen phone use is not black or white you’re being too rigid and closed minded not all kids are into drugs bullying porn going off with a predator etc real life day to day is much less provocative give her information and tools to make good choices don’t assume she’ll make bad ones

i won’t bother reading replies of pearl clutching “how dare you deprive your child of mush brain inducing technology she might get good grades and not suffer from anxiety and depression like the rest of our kids ” in greta thunberg voice *how dare you * i always told my girls that i’m not others parents and they don’t make our rules do what you think is correct for her age the second you give her unsupervised and unlimited access to the internet say goodbye to childhood innocence other kids probably have spoiled that already many parents just hand the tech to the kid and never have to parent again you’re taking a difficult approach but doing the right thing is never easy i not only restrict access but also monitor activity because they’re not adults they often get in over their head and are put in adult situations as a girl she will likely face bullying become insecure about herself get into trends that are destructive or inappropriate when you do give her a phone look at monitoring apps like ourpact and bark you can control some of what she sees and does on her device

personally i think your compromises overall sound good she has the opportunity to interact with her friends and gets to watch certain things and play certain games however to me personally one yellow flag in your post is the phrase dedicated to preserving her youth because it is precious you simply cannot force a child to stay a child she's almost she has or will very soon develop all of those teen attributes physically and emotionally and mentally she's going to learn about see hear things you don't want her to make sure she knows she can talk to you about them and be proactive to discuss sensitive topics with her
unfortunately we think not giving them access to those things doesn't stop what you are trying to do children talk they seem to know a lot more then i ever did and they talk about it

for us social media no she allowed phone with parental controls she leaves it down stairs at night otherwise she would be awake all night on it roblox she has with all communication turn off she has autism it’s timed her friend list is people she know in real life and her friends what’s app group call when playing have conversations about safety online she needs to be internet and computer savvy so helping navigate is the way forward and keeping her safe is essential to see what course are available or workshops to keeping her safe online

you are way too strict keep this up and she'll go wild in college move away from you ask me how i know this to be true let her have a device and guide her you have to trust her at some point and this is the age to learn which means parental controls to a point and keeping an eye on it just like everything else

i personally think it’s too strict
no you’re not trust your parenting instincts phones are not good for tween and teen’s mental health
yes you’re doing her a disservice

technology is a part of the world we live in most of the upcoming careers take place in the tech and gaming industries not allowing exposure and familiarity to these things puts a child at a disadvantage i dealt with a lot of these kids in college and had to teach so many of them how to use basic computer skills because their parents had sheltered them so much from tech stuff i was an older non traditional student and couldn't believe these kids didn't have basic life skills with a computer phone also as someone with adhd who is also a mother to adhd children i have never found strict regulation to be effective it has only ever made impulse control issues worse when we feel like something is limited or off limits to us instead of being able to freely access it then it makes us super anxious and more prone to lash out my children have free access to their devices in their free time and some days they will use them a lot some days they won't touch them and will spend all day outside or crafting

in … in th grade… i had a phone i would say you are doing a disservice because her youth can still be protected and she can have a phone there just has to be limits th grade is an important time to make friends and what’s she’s supposed to write notes

honestly this is one of those situations where you have to weigh her social life against her safety she's going to get older and she's going to need an actual phone someday right now you can just get her a kid's phone that doesn't have internet access right now she's only and there's no reason to be giving her access to these apps

it's a very hard vice to ignore and almost impossible when you're young some parents we are friends with have dedicated the weekend or just one day as *no screen day* and use that to preserve their child rens youth i wouldn't say you're doing a disservice but certainly contributing to the reasons why she might not be as up to date with pop culture as her peers

i’m definitely not found of roblox and don’t like tiktok for under year olds but youtube i mean a lot of middle schools use those videos for class work and even assign assignments using them if your kid was i’d be all behind you but she’ll be soon and you need to start allowing her limited access in order to understand how to regulate and deal with them internet safety boundaries and limitations are all things my friends and i had to learn ourselves born in our parents didn’t know enough to protect us but our older siblings did we ended i doing a lot of things we should’ve have been online and the only time we really would learn would be if someone caught us which wasn’t often

no social media but let her play roblox and watch youtube thats the rule with my daughter and i heavily supervise her use shes not allowed to add or message anyone unless she knows them irl havent had any issues so far social media is a big no from me though
fuck it stick to your guns eventually get her an apple watch if you want she can make calls from it and text but she totally doesn’t need that right now

it's up to you but i'm surprised any of her friends use facebook messenger to chat here is whatsapp and discord honestly it depends on what your plans are for increasing her boundaries eveb with the adhd im assuming you are starting to let the reins off a bit and her hang out with her friends unsupervised at the park etc i think then a phone is vital even if just a flip handset with no net

i can’t speak for how your daughter feels about being one of the only to not have a phone with her peers she probably feels left out but i don’t think not having robolox youtube tic toc is a disservice and i wouldn’t allow her access right away or at all that’s up to you but i think she should maybe for christmas if you celebrate get a phone with restrictions that at least allow her to contact you approved contacts and restrict to time use at home example have her put the phone in the kitchen or your room to charge at pm pm can’t use it at home unless homework is done additional rule is keeps it on when she’s out at a friends so you can alway las reach her she can reach you

i’m sure she feels excluded and it’s helpful to talk about that and maybe have monitored minute daily sessions or somethn but as someone who studies neurodevelopment you’re doing the right thing esp cause she has adhd the longer kids can stay away from devices the better their emotional regulation is likely to be given that they also have adequate support its not just about screens kudos to you guys for doing this

i don’t allow my y o to have tiktok or twitter he doesn’t have ig as he needs it for a class and these kids don’t care about fb lol when he plays games he never uses chat or speaks with strangers there was a time that happened and he got in big trouble and had to earn everything back all the kids around here just facetime each other and play they don’t think it’s as fun when talking to others

yea i think you are doing your daughter a disservice because you are basically saying that you don’t trust her and you don’t think she’s old enough to understand the dangers you are going to be disappointed when you realise that she will be able to access the internet in many other places and you will probably have no clue about it because i bet you she’s the only one who’s parents are over protective if you have honest conversations with your children from the earliest times then you are giving them the tools to make good decisions you are nearly forcing her to break the rules just so she is part of the conversation don’t be so cruel

former parenting coach here and mom of years fwiw allow access in small supervised doses and utilize every parental control imaginable but also talk with them about what to expect to see when hanging with friends yep like porn because it's going to happen be proactive instead of reactive and show them you are a safe space to talk about their experiences this will possibly prevent a lot of sneaking around or feelings of shame and guilt that will shut down open communication between you you don't have to be graphic or anything but at least lay the groundwork in small doses the more you restrict especially without explanation the more enticing something becomes edited a typo

my yr old has a phone but it’s an iphone and her account is set up as a child’s account she needs to ask my permission to download anything and i can monitor her phone from my devices i have not allowed her access to social media yet she’s one of the last in her grade to have no social media accounts i do not regret it

as someone who grew up similarly yes you're setting her back socially i cannot say it did not impact where i am now because it absolutely did limiting use is all well and good but denying such an integral part of society completely puts kids in really messy situations being ostracized sucks being bullied is worse

well for me i think we have to accept this is a digital world now and a lot of socialising is done on these apps your kid needs to learn how to use them what to be mindful of how to behave online what to alert you to etc life skills nowadays includes how to manage social media it is something you need to arm your kid with as to when you think it’s appropriate for your kid i mean you know your child best and their environment it’s kind of up to you for me at i would feel it’s reasonable to allow some access

no this is just good parenting you know your kid using what other people do as a barometer is a bad idea the majority of parents are lazy and let their kids do whatever and eventually will pay for that social media and phones are absolutely screwing up kids and adults bad

you know your kid best but if you get her a phone you gotta monitor it super closely this applies to all kids to some degree but my time in spec ed has shown me that phones and adhd are a bad mix in kids good luck it’s a hard decision

you know movies have a rating called parental guidance advised i find that if my kid experience something for older audience but i'm there to answer her questions and guide her the end result is way better than if she listened to it alone the same can be done with roblox youtube and tick tock you play listen with her answer her questions and show her how to use those things in an healthy safe way i had a neighbour kid come over and start talking about what clearly a minecraft streamer saying things about subscriber i asked him if he knew what a subscriber was he did not know i feel repeating things without understanding is where the danger is and the more something is prohibited the more chances you won't be there to guide her when she does try those things youtube and tick tock can be good learning platform roblox can be a good social platform you start by doing it together and over time as you see her use it you could get to a point where you let her use it at limited time alone and if she doesnt use it in a good way she loses access that one hell of a motivator she could go from my parent are too strict and to i lost my roblox privilege because i was speaking with people i did not know when i knew it was not allowed

this is a tough one me and the wife are younger parents to an year old and we let him use roblox and youtube we do our best to monitor what he does and so far no issues or concerns but he does have friends who are on strict no phone or youtube and i can tell those kids are not included in everyone’s playtime as they don’t understand the references as they get older they will all share their interests and dislikes i would be worried i am ostracizing my child from his peers by being too strict we had a very serious conversation before we let him start using roblox about weirdos on the internet and too never engage anyone and tell us if anything happens i definitely do agree it’s a risk as the internet can be dangerous and full of weirdos

i think you’re doing great by allowing some access to technology but not completely keeping her from it when they get older you just have to adjust it’s hard but i do think you should try to integrate some stuff to make it seem like they aren’t missing out regular youtube can be pretty bad that’s why i like youtube kids you can pick individual creators and other content so that you know what they’re watching you can start by picking stuff and previewing it although i’m not sure at what age this becomes pointless tiktok is a hard no many predators on there and messed up stuff a kid that age doesn’t need to be exposed to there’s actually no value to it unlike youtube where there’s lots of easy to monitor content that can be educational or fun youtube is already not great for adhd kids if they tend to flip through stuff so tiktok would be a pretty tough one on the attention span with the short videos and whatnot roblox is tough there’s a lot of content on there that’s fine but the kids and adults may not be it helps that they’ve really limited what can be said on chat but if you’re still worried you can filter this by turning off chat options but i’m not sure how easy it would be for a kid her age to undo that and haven’t had to do that myself yet i recommend monitoring her chats with friends i personally know parents who’s children have sent images to friends that they shouldn’t have and those things have been shared and lots of bullying that can happen don’t do this behind her back i would say that you just need to have a conversation with her about how things can be safe and you want to make sure she is safe not that you are constantly looking at stuff but that you will check in occasionally to make sure everything is pg or if you feel like you don’t want to intrude at all there may be a way to prevent picture sharing etc on the kids messenger app i think in a couple years these restrictions can be lifted as you see fit but regardless you need to have a conversation with her about the internet if you haven’t already this can be as simple as hey just like the real world the internet isn’t safe always there is adult stuff that you don’t want to see and that there are people that may try to talk to you for the wrong reasons this is why you only talk to people that you know in real life that are your friends in chat if you’re on roblox and you’re playing with someone you don’t know do not give out personal information because we don’t know who they are and there’s no way of knowing you don’t want a stranger to know where we live or your full name because we don’t know if they are safe even if you think they may be nice in a couple years you can add more details as questions may arise another thing is you let your kid know that if there’s anything that they see or find on the internet that makes them feel weird or scares them they can always come to you and talk about it you won’t be mad there’s a lot of things children just won’t understand and may not be ready to be exposed to you’re there for them and can help explain anything that may be weird you’re right sometimes it can be a disservice when they get old enough to make those decisions or go behind your back and haven’t had any of this conversation or exposure to the internet it can put them in very dangerous situations you’re doing great hope this helps

my son has adhd and he has had a phone since he was in kindergarten our routine was it would go in the backpack when he got home it would go straight to a bowl if he wanted to use it for games he would ask and we would let him have it for min during the week as long as homework and chores were done i also installed google family link both my husband and i are supervisors and can lock his phone from anywhere or block apps however he didn't start to use it for friends until the last months my kids are not allowed to play roblox but they do play minecraft my husband will also play with them at times he also started playing that with friends he prefers to use kid messenger to chat with his friends too youtube we have it restricted to older kid on google family link i do check to see what he's watching sometimes to make sure he's not watching anything he shouldn't now that he likes his phone even more we switched our house to earning phone time he recently got braces so good teeth brushing earns phone time chores and homework earn phone time behavior and doing his best in school just like any kids we have not approved apps or purchases taken the phone away for not listening etc at times i've had to lock his phone so i could get his attention once he's done what i needed i unlock it and he can go back to what he was doing we also have set times for when the phone will lock for the night and unlock the next day it's always the same time every day so there aren't surprises one of our biggest rules is if they complain over this then they won't get their phone the next day i try to give them a min warning before the phone will lock for the night and that seems to help overall we can control content and usage he knows and it's not an issue since it's been like that from the beginning

there is gabb wireless which is a phone without internet you can take photos text amd talk my yo has one because we want to be able tor each her when she isn't with us but don't feel she needs internet on thr phone she has a computer and tablet and an old phone of mine to use at home only for data so she doesn't need a smart phone just food for thought

mine is almost with adhd as well he has a flipphone but that's it he has access to an old smartphone but it can only be used on wifi and it's usually just used when we play pokemon go we've talked a lot about how he's going to hit milestones at different times than his friends sometimes sooner sometimes later i've also discussed with him how impulse control is a struggle that many folks with adhd face and that dad and i will sometimes say 'no' for him if we don't think he can consistently do it himself all of that said having access to the old smartphone has been a good gauge a couple of years ago he would try to sneak it to bed or find workarounds for the parental controls he's got a lot more respect for the rules now and he understands if they're broken the phone goes away for a while all that to say you're not a terrible parent for not priming your kid's brain to be addicted to tech before she's even old enough to drive kids have lived for thousands of years without cell phones and anyone who would ostracize or bulky her for not having a phone isn't a friend she wants anyway

it could very ostracize her i have a daughter the same age but she like many kids have had phones for years now my daughters use iphones they have to get permission that is sent my iphone and requires my face id to download any apps i also have their log ins for all of their accounts you could still get her a phone but keep the apps under control by making all app downloads need permission and keep her to youtube kids rather than all access to youtube i would still make it a requirement that you need to be in the room when she uses youtube kids or if you allow tiktok you must be in the same room i understand the reasoning you want to keep her from these platforms kids her age and younger are given unmonitored access to these things which i believe is dangerous and far too much freedom a good balance can be found and as my kids grow and they are able to earn more freedoms
pinwheel is a nice starter phone that's easily controlled i don't believe in the social media apps either

i have a yr old soon to be i gave him a phone he turn it off in school he doesn’t have social media or tiktok he also has adhd he is not included in the class chat and i think is better he use roblox to play with his friends they have parental controls they can’t upload anything without my consent also i have him the phone to be able to call me or dad now he can be at practice alone and call me when is time we don’t have land phone so is very convenient he communicates with all my family called grandma’s etc the thing is the most you don’t allowed something is worst better to teach them how to use things i will not allow him to use social media yet but definitely he feels more secure to be able to call anyone if he needs to

our boys got phones at the year before secondary school as it would be then they'd be expected to walk to and from school alone the important thing for kids this age is not removing access it's limiting access put strong parental controls on the phone i use family link which sets a time limit doesn't allow download of apps without parental acceptance and sends alerts should they try and access anything they shouldn't at nearly i still have these controls on my twins phones with their consent as they recognise they have poor impulse control otherwise and would spend hours on their phones we also have xboxes and playstations with similar controls it's up to you how you do it but we did the above with the understanding that phones were a privilege not a right and that their father and i reserve the right to check through messages etc if we're worried we haven't done that for a long time

my preteen has access to an xbox and a chromebook both with parent monitoring but my ex her mother got her a smartphone without consulting me despite me being the residential parent and our daughter living here most of the time it was one of those things where instead of active parenting some people just buy things for their kids ie my ex never help my daughter with schoolwork or riding a bike etc but she'll buy random devices and stuff my wife and i were pretty upset as was my ex's husband my daughter has since developed symptoms of phone addiction and a detachment from reality loss of social skills lethargic attitude about hygiene homework chores etc all that matters is being on her phone it's been an uphill battle but she's started to realize the issues and no longer resists screen time limits yes other kids have smartphones but the chat threads my daughter has been involved in with them has led to a lot of drama ie kids learning how to be keyboard warriors instead of handling problems face to face thereby inviting a lot of miscommunication and misunderstanding ironically i think it's because of this ease and submersion within text thread drama that persuaded my daughter about the merits of screen time limits so op i do not think that you are doing your child a disservice to the contrary i believe that what you are doing is much better for their mental wellbeing in the long run working in organizational psychology i've seen lots of research around the impact of smartphones on brain development and mental health remember these devices not just the apps and social media mind you but the devices themselves are built to grab one's attention and hold it in part this is what's led to the dumb phone counterculture trend

she’s gettting to the age where you can’t preserve her youth too much she’ll rebel if every kid has a phone she should have one if you can this is the age i feel does she go places without you friends houses she should have one prob

i have a and year old who both have phones and adhd though not social media my son talks to his friends on discord i don't think you're being too strict at all and if i could do so without it being such a punishment i would unring the bell of letting them both have devices though there are aspects where it's very useful maybe as she gets old enough to be going out on her own more you can give her a cheap phone to use when she's out but set up limits on it as for the social aspect it might impact her ability to build friendships but how many friends from jr high were still your primary friends in high school i wouldnt stress it too much you know what your kid needs and adhd is a bitch to manage even without an addictive dopamine machine on your person at all times

when i f was young i was never allowed to do what the other kids did in the name of protecting me it made me an outcast and i never did fit in even in high school i allow my kids to be a part of the culture that surrounds them with parental controls in place

when i was a kid everyone had a landline and i could call someone’s house if i wanted to talk now that’s not the case so i think we’ll have to get our kids phones soon oldest is just so they can have a social life

you may run into social delays but honestly it’s whichever is the greater evil if you do give the phone and unrestricted access to tiktok youtube etc it will definitely cause different problems and behaviors especially with high tendency for phone addiction with adhd 🤷🏼‍♀️

my kiddo is a year younger with severe adhd we also limit screentime and have rules in place we allow roblox and also youtube with parental controls but absolutely no tiktok or any form of social media he also does not have a phone he used to have a phone for emergencies last year but lost the privilege after not using it for its intended purpose so it became clear to us that he does not need one right now i think you know your kid best but unless she would need the phone i don't see the use of it at this age

the thing is the more u restrict the more sneaky they get i wasn't allowed a phone i was when i got one and only because i was walking to and from school i wasn't allowed any social media or to give out my number i didn't listen to that i got social media all under fake names so my parents wouldn't find me i had to put my phone on the charger in the loungroom every day at pm i'd uninstall all social media apps before it went on charge cause i knew my mum would look and after they went to bed i'd get up and sneak my phone when i'd get busted i'd loose my phone for a period of time so i'd just wait till my mum left the house and go through her stuff to find it

the way my cousin and her husband handled their kids access to social media is what i think is good it might not be for everyone but they set up the accounts with an email account only they had access to their kids could use social media but parents had control they could only add approved pictures add people they personally knew and it was always checked when they had been on aka daily lol well they didn't always check but say mom and dad knew they were on that day but they saw nothing they would check it out because they knew you could hide things from others i do that with my kids but they don't have anything to hide and don't resent it they would rather i check and use it than not use it at all they also do tiktok but me or dad record and post for them

i don’t think it is preserving her youth lol but it is perfectly fine that she doesn’t have a phone or specific apps my daughter has multiple friends without phones she has friends with apps she can’t have and friends that can’t have apps that she does it works just fine
my kid didn't have a phone until she was and it is a cheapo motorola from tracfone she's fine your kid will be fine

my kiddo is younger but lots of her friends are already on tiktok roblox we've disallowed that along with other things like drinking soda sorry we're the parents and not ok with it we're keeping her safe

haven’t read the other comments but have you considered getting her an apple watch my daughter just started middle school and this is what she has she is still able to be a part of the text chains and call with the other girls but doesn’t have access to the apps and addictive aspects of a cell phone she also has a tablet with facetime and messenger but we’ve had to take it away because she also has adhd and impulse control and her emotions and attitude are out of control when she has access to all the apps and things on the tablet i feel that same pressure about her being left out but honestly i think in the end we are doing them a favor kids with phones do nothing but watch tik toks and obsess over things they’re too young for and don’t actually interact or play it’s also been shown that specifically for young girls that social media causes depression the longer you put that off the better

it's a difficult one and ultimately it comes down to what works for you and what you think is right for your child anything in moderation is mine and my partner's motto we allow my son a phone but there are certain lines around when and where he can use it and if he tries to abuse these there are penalties for this it's hard i would rather he didn't even have a phone at but it's the times all his friends communicate through it and we use it to keep in touch with him when he's out and about so we don't want to cut him off entirely it isn't perfect there are degrees of drama involved but we've found that trusting him he has returned this trust and the issues we occasionally have are around usage but not truthfulness which was the biggest concern we have we trust him to use it correctly and be honest if there are issues and building this trust we have found to be really important as he gets older and doesn't just view us as ogre parents who just shout no and he has to hide things from take everyone's advice but ultimately you need to make the call that you are comfortable with
your kid will probably be the only one not on anti depressants

i think roblox is wildly inappropriate for children i work with intellectually disabled adults that use the platform inappropriately and it has opened my eyes to the egregious nature of the game… that being said i cannot convince my stepdaughters bio parents that it’s not acceptable it’s not my decision anyway and it feels like a losing battle the internet is not a safe place for kids or tweens and this roblox thing is basically a playground for dangers of the internet and i never thought i would be the “uncool” adult to restrict my kids from things but … any parent letting their minor child in a role playing open source online community is really whacked out it’s no different than reddit

here's the thing whether you let her have tiktok now or not she's still exposed to it through her friends withholding it from her may feel safe but at the same time when she gets it she's gonna go nuts with it unless you teach her how to use it one account mom can see and a secret account she can't those of us with strict parents did that the day after we finally got a phone computer learned how to make a nd email account build trust instead maybe let her have the roblox game but she's only allowed to play in the living room when you or dad are home around like when i was a kid the big thing was to keep the family computer in the living room now everyone has a computer in their pocket so that isn't as feasible but you can still enforce similar rules you can play roblox with friends but not in secret or alone never chat with people you don't know or give personal information i'll let you have tiktok but you can not make content i'll set up your profile as private and you can follow your friends and like videos but i'll be checking who you are following and we will discuss which accounts i feel are inappropriate and if i decide you unfollow them you will do so or lose the privilege of the app i like youtube too let's make you an account and subscribe to a few fun channels a few educational ones and please come tell me if you ever see something that makes you uncomfortable and we can report it i'd prefer it if you watched youtube in the living room make sure you have her emails and passwords for them all with youtube you can log in and see her watch history sometimes things pop up if you leave a video playing and it auto plays the next so be open and say hey did you watch this you aren't in trouble i just want to talk about it because it's a bit adult and i'm uncomfortable with you viewing this sort of thing i have had to do this with my yo a lot i'll go to wash dishes while she's watching bluey on youtube and i'll hear something isn't the same and walk back in to see it changed to sirenhead attacking peppa pig's family and i switched it back to kid appropriate programming but sat down and asked was that scary are you alright with internet stuff i feel like we need to give our kids tools to know how to navigate and also be open so they come to us i'd rather my tween say hey i had some rando message me weird stuff than hide it from me in fear that i'll take their phone computer game away and meanwhile said rando is pulling out all the stops and gaslighting them with oh i scared you but don't worry i'm a friend let's just talk about school i hated math do you and then slowly earning their trust because they're naiive about how these awful people work
new parent here but i look up to this type of screen time regulation i think you will be doing a good service to them long term
you could do a flip phone or a smart phone with parental controls i think this is what we will do with our son he gets hour of game time twice a week he will play harmless games on my old smart phone

the world is a terrible place and keepin ur child safe from that is our jobs as parents i think it’s a great idea bc kids get so desensitized between music movies and social media these days we have to do what we must i had strict parents and hated it until i became a parent adult hearing stories that so many ppl go through i didn’t have to worry abt some of that stuff bc of my parents so keep doing you 🥳

no i don’t think you’re doing her a disservice my oldest will be in january and also has adhd she does not have a phone or ipad and i don’t see that changing anytime soon but she does have a kindle fire with parental controls enabled she hasn’t been deprived like your daughter she can call text facetime friends from my phone and she is able to play minecraft on the playstation or the computer she just isn’t allowed to use a multiplayer server her school issues everyone a chromebook so she is able to use that too but we monitor and regulate access after school and on the weekends just to ensure she’s getting her assignments done and isn’t getting distracted by other things she doesn’t have access to roblox or tiktok and her youtube access on my phone and the kindle fire is limited unfortunately it is not so limited on the chromebook and she has a tendency to doomscroll and watch content that has been questionable at times youtube has honestly been a huge issue for my kids and their access wasn’t always so limited but i’ve found that it works best for our family which is full of neurodivergent individuals to set those limits because right now they just aren’t great at creating and enforcing those boundaries for themselves— which is understandable and probably age appropriate and will hopefully improve as they grow and learn more of those skills we talk about this stuff openly and i tell her why i set these boundaries i also listen to my daughter when she feels like i’m not not being fair sometimes i agree with her and we change things up sometimes i don’t and i tell her we can’t compromise on “x” right now but let’s think of other ways i can help her feel like she has more agency control freedoms we also talk a lot about how what works for other families may not be what works for ours and that’s okay and ultimately it’s my job to keep her safe and ensure she’s accessing and using technology in age appropriate ways the school she’s at this year has hosted events before where experts come talk about how to stay safe online highlight the risks and dangers of social media etc so i plan on having her come with me when they host them this year because i think it’s important for her to be part of the bigger conversation too

in my opinion this is a bit strict i wouldn't allow tiktok regular youtube or roblox online but i would allow a phone with safeguarding restrictions i think it's important to teach kids how to safely use technology rather than banning it and ostracizing her from her peers has long term consequences on social development you can get her a phone and make it so she can't download apps and put software like bark on it to keep her safe also talk to her about the dangers if the internet make sure she feels safe coming to you with questions rather than asking google
with all the weird and dangerous trends happening in the internet mostly by her age of kids i dont think you're wrong waren'tnt allowing social media platforms either
stay away from roblox if anything some games are extremely inappropriate disturbing and generally not child friendly topics and filters are challenging

my daughters are and no phones yet they use my tablet for pinterest of course i can see the history their school banned cellphones and they have to stay in their locker i've never worried about what others thought i'm teaching my children the same i work in criminal law and have seen too many predators i compare it to leaving my children unattended on a street corner which i wouldn't but the internet is more dangerous than that in my opinion

no you are not doing her a disservice there is plenty of research to show that extended screen time social media etc directly impact kids’ mental health if i could do it over again we would not have given our foster kids who came to us at that age a phone there are so many people who prey on young and impressionable tweens even when you think you have safeguards in place we found that out the hard way and had to go through police investigations the whole nine yards as a teacher i see so many kids who do not have impulse controls when it comes to their screens they can’t put it away and then parents act shocked when kid is failing even after i’ve told them kid is on phone instead of paying attention a good middle ground is a phone like troomi it is what we use it’s a normal smartphone with special software you can enable features as you feel the kid is ready for them at its most restrictive all contacts need to be approved there is no group text pictures no internet any apps have to be approved etc and you can check every text you can also turn off texting during specific times we have had to do this with one of our teenagers it is a great tool because it allows them a chance to communicate with friends and slowly earn freedom while not giving them more than they can handle at the time
